author: Michael Silverman
title: Don Orsillo: 'There couldn't be a better landing spot than San Diego' | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
text:
NEW YORK -- As painful as it was to be shown the door by NESN and the Red Sox, Don Orsillo understands how fortunate he is to have landed on his feet as the next Padres' announcer.
Not long before the Padres announced his hiring this evening, Orsillo's gratitude was on full display.
“I'd like to very much thank the San Diego Padres, president and CEO Mike Dee and the Padres ownership for giving me my next chapter," said Orsillo. "I'm looking forward to becoming the voice of Padres baseball. I'm very excited about the opportunity to continue my career in Major League Baseball and there couldn't be a better landing spot than San Diego.”
Counting tonight's game, Orsillo still has five games remaining on his NESN contract. On Sunday, in his last game at Fenway after 15 years, he was the subject of a prolonged ovation from fans after the Red Sox played a between-innings tribute to him.
“Last Sunday at Fenway Park will stay with me forever as will the 15 years that I spent in Boston," said Orsillo. "I will never forget the fans and the way that they treated me and said good-bye to me.”
The Red Sox and NESN underestimated the backlash of fans -- some 62,000 signatures were collected on an online petition -- from removing Orsillo from telecasts. Orsillo, who took the news hard, appreciated the support.
“All the support – I've heard it all, I've read them and I'm completely humbled by their feelings for me,” said Orsillo.
